titleStmt.title: The honest maydens loyalty or, The young mans faithfull constancy. He vowes to endure the wrack and the [...] and suffer dearly for his true loves sake. To a pretty new tune, or Wert thou more fairer.

The honest maydens loyalty or, The young mans faithfull constancy. He vowes to endure the wrack and the [...] and suffer dearly for his true loves sake. To a pretty new tune, or Wert thou more fairer.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for W. G[ilbertson]. dwelling in Gilt-spur-street,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Verse: "Most early in a morning faire ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
Imperfect: mutilated, affecting title and text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
